refnamediv.refpurpose: Information on how to prepare the runtime environment for testing

refsect1.title: Setting up the Diagnostic Log and Trace (DLT) framework
refsect1.para: In order to support manual testing, the Node Startup Controller logs any useful information using the Diagnostic Log and Trace (DLT) framework. The DLT runtime components relevant for testing are the dlt-daemon and the dlt-receive tools.

refsect1.title: Reading DLT log
refsect1.para: In order to check whether the Node Startup Controller behaves correctly, the messages it logs to the DLT have to be investigated. The log file is not plain text, so a special tool called dlt-convert needs to be used to convert it into human-readable form.
The dlt-convert tool can be executed using the following command:
This will display the contents of the log file in the following format:
refsect1.programlisting: Index Time Timestamp Count Ecuid Apid Ctid Type Subtype Mode #Args Payload
12 2012/08/01 10:30:32.247913 17066086 006 ECU1 NSC- CTRL log info V 1 [Active state of unit "node-startup-controller.service" changed to active]
refsect1.para: The fields we are interested for debugging and testing in are the Apid (Application ID), Ctid (Context ID) and the Payload. The test cases described in the following chapters include the exact log values for these fields needed to verify the correctness of behaviour of the Node Startup Controller.
